instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00044: What is 820-00044? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (phantom CPU failures). general question
threads.message:
I have only worked on maybe 15-20 of these machines and I heard rumors of phantom CPU problems. Not the normal CPU failure were the buck converter driver shorts PP-BUS to the cpu but strange CPU failures.

I am just knocking on the door of people out there to see if it is worth my time to invest in tooling to start changing CPU's on these machines. I have to custom order nozzles for my BGA rework machine and my cost on each nozzle is close to $500 when I have them custom made so I am looking for feed back before I order one.

I started changing CPU's on the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00044</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> today and did have success so I am focusing on these for the time being but am interested to see if there is opportunity on these other boards.   CPU availability and pricing is still real sketchy for the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and similar boards but that will change in the coming months.
